intro: Isoloma ignoratum, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making clothing and baskets. Isoloma ignoratum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
